member.name: T:Sys.IDisposable
member.summary: Provides a common interface for application-defined tasks associated with closing, releasing, or resetting resources held by instances of a registered Microsoft AJAX Library class.

member.name: M:Sys.IDisposable.Dispose
member.summary: Releases resources held by an object, or prepares an object for reuse.

member.name: T:Sys.Net.WebServiceProxy
member.summary: Enables calling a method of a specified Web service asynchronously.

member.name: M:Sys.Net.WebServiceProxy.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Sys.Net.WebServiceProxy.Invoke(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Dictionary)
member.summary: Invokes the specified Web service method.
member.param: The Web service URL.
The name of the Web service method to invoke.
false if the Web request HTTP verb is POST; otherwise, true. The default is false.
A dictionary that contains name/value pairs that correspond to the parameters of the method to call.
member.returns: The that was created to invoke the method.

member.name: M:Sys.Net.WebServiceProxy.Invoke(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Dictionary,Sys.Net.WebServiceSuccessCallback,Sys.Net.WebServiceFailureCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Invokes the specified Web service method.
member.param: The Web service URL.
The name of the Web service method to invoke.
false if the Web request HTTP verb is POST; otherwise, true. The default is false.
A dictionary that contains name/value pairs that correspond to the parameters of the method to call.
The function invoked as a callback if the Web service method call returns successfully. If no callback function is provided, no action is taken when the Web service method finishes successfully.
The function invoked as a callback if the Web service method call fails. If no callback function is provided, no action is taken if an error occurs during the Web service method call.
Any user-specific information to be passed to either callback.
member.returns: The that was created to invoke the method.

member.name: M:Sys.Net.WebServiceProxy.Invoke(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Dictionary,Sys.Net.WebServiceSuccessCallback,Sys.Net.WebServiceFailureCallback,System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Invokes the specified Web service method.
member.param: The Web service URL.
The name of the Web service method to invoke.
false if the Web request HTTP verb is POST; otherwise, true. The default is false.
A dictionary that contains name/value pairs that correspond to the parameters of the method to call.
The function invoked as a callback if the Web service method call returns successfully. If no callback function is provided, no action is taken when the Web service method finishes successfully.
The function invoked as a callback if the Web service method call fails. If no callback function is provided, no action is taken if an error occurs during the Web service method call.
Any user-specific information to be passed to either callback.
The time in milliseconds after which the request is timed out and aborted.
member.returns: The that was created to invoke the method.

member.name: P:Sys.Net.WebServiceProxy.DefaultFailedCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the default failed callback function for the instance.

member.name: P:Sys.Net.WebServiceProxy.DefaultSucceededCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the default succeeded callback function for the instance.

member.name: P:Sys.Net.WebServiceProxy.DefaultUserContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the default user context for the instance.

member.name: P:Sys.Net.WebServiceProxy.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the Web service for the instance.

member.name: P:Sys.Net.WebServiceProxy.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time-out value in milliseconds for the instance.

member.name: T:Sys.StringBuilder
member.summary: Provides an optimized mechanism to concatenate strings.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Sys.StringBuilder.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The string that is used to initialize the value of the instance. If the value is null, the new StringBuilder instance will contain an empty string ("").

member.summary: Appends a copy of a specified string to the end of the instance.
member.param: The string to append to the end of the StringBuilder instance.

member.summary: Appends a string with a line terminator to the end of the instance.

member.summary: Appends a string with a line terminator to the end of the instance.
member.param: The string to append with a line terminator to the end fo the StringBuilder instance.

member.summary: Clears the contents of the instance.

member.name: M:Sys.StringBuilder.IsEmpty
member.summary: Determines whether the object has any content.
member.returns: true if the StringBuilder instance contains no elements; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Sys.StringBuilder.ToString
member.summary: Creates a string from the contents of a instance.
member.returns: A string representation of the StringBuilder instance.

member.name: M:Sys.StringBuilder.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a string from the contents of a instance, and optionally inserts a delimeter between each element of the created string.
member.param: A string to append between each element of the string that is returned.
member.returns: A string representation of the StringBuilder instance. If is specified, the delimeter string is inserted between each element of the returned string.

member.name: T:Sys.Component
member.summary: Provides the base class for the and classes, and for any other object whose lifetime should be managed by Microsoft ASP.NET AJAX.

member.name: T:Sys.INotifyDisposing
member.summary: Defines the Disposing event.

member.name: E:Sys.INotifyDisposing.Disposing
member.summary: Occurs when an object's resources are released.

member.name: T:Sys.INotifyPropertyChange
member.summary: Defines the PropertyChanged event.

member.name: E:Sys.INotifyPropertyChange.PropertyChanged
member.summary: Occurs when a component property is set to a new value.

member.name: M:Sys.Component.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Sets the property of the current object to true.

member.name: M:Sys.Component.Create(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns a new instance of the class that uses the specified parameters and calls the method.
member.param: The type of the component to create.
member.returns: A new instance of the Component class that uses the specified parameters.

member.name: M:Sys.Component.Create(System.Type,System.Dictionary,System.Dictionary,System.Dictionary,System.DHTML.DOMElement)
member.summary: Returns a new instance of the class that uses the specified parameters and calls the method.
member.param: The type of the component to create.
A JSON object that describes the properties and their values.
A JSON object that describes the events and their handlers.
A JSON object that describes the properties that are references to other components.
The DOM element the component must be attached to.
member.returns: A new instance of the Component class that uses the specified parameters.

member.name: M:Sys.Component.Dispose
member.summary: Raises the event of the current object and removes the component from the application.

member.name: M:Sys.Component.EndUpdate
member.summary: Sets the property of the current object to false, calls the method if it has not already been called, and then calls the method.

member.name: M:Sys.Component.Initialize
member.summary: Sets the property of the current object to true.

member.name: M:Sys.Component.RaisePropertyChanged(System.String)
member.summary: Raises the event for the specified property.
member.param: The name of the property that changed.

member.name: M:Sys.Component.Updated
member.summary: Has no built-in functionality; the Updated method is a placeholder for post-update logic in derived classes.

member.name: P:Sys.Component.Events
member.summary: Gets an object that contains references to all the events and handlers for the current object.

member.name: P:Sys.Component.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the current object.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current object is initialized.

member.name: P:Sys.Component.IsUpdating
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current object is updating.

member.name: E:Sys.Component.Disposing
member.summary: Raised when the method is called for a component.

member.summary: Raised when a property changes.

member.name: T:Sys.Services.AuthenticationService
member.summary: Provides the client proxy class for the authentication service.

member.name: M:Sys.Services.AuthenticationService.Login(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Authenticates the user's credentials.
member.param: The user name to authenticate.
The user's password. The default is null.

member.name: M:Sys.Services.AuthenticationService.Login(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,Sys.Services.AuthenticationServiceLoginCallback,Sys.Net.WebServiceFailureCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Authenticates the user's credentials.
member.param: The user name to authenticate.
The user's password. The default is null.
true if the issued authentication ticket should be persistent across browser sessions; otherwise, false. The default is false.
Reserved for future use. The default is null.
The URL to redirect the browser to on successful authentication. If null, no redirect occurs. The default is null.
The function to call when the login has finished successfully. The default is null.
The function to call if the login fails. The default is null.
User context information that you are passing to the callback functions.

member.name: M:Sys.Services.AuthenticationService.Logout
member.summary: Logs out the currently authenticated user.

member.name: M:Sys.Services.AuthenticationService.Logout(System.String,Sys.Net.WebServiceSuccessCallback,Sys.Net.WebServiceFailureCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Logs out the currently authenticated user.
member.param: The URL to redirect the browser to on successful logout. The default is null.
The function that is called when the logout has finished. The default is null.
The function that is called if the logout has failed. The default is null.
User context information that you are passing to the callback functions.

member.returns: The element with the specified ID.

member.name: T:Sys.Debug
member.summary: Provides debugging and tracing functionality for client code. This is a static class that is invoked directly without creating an instance of the class.

member.name: M:Sys.Debug.Assert(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks for a condition, and if false, displays a message and prompts the user to break into the debugger.
member.param: true to continue to execute code; false to display message and break into the debugger.

member.name: M:Sys.Debug.Assert(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Checks for a condition, and if false, displays a message and prompts the user to break into the debugger.
member.param: true to continue to execute code; false to display message and break into the debugger.
The message to display. The default is an empty string ("").

member.name: M:Sys.Debug.Assert(System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks for a condition, and if false, displays a message and prompts the user to break into the debugger.
member.param: true to continue to execute code; false to display message and break into the debugger.
The message to display. The default is an empty string ("").
true to indicate that the name of the function that is calling assert should be displayed in the message. The default is false.

member.name: M:Sys.Debug.ClearTrace
member.summary: Clears all trace messages from the debugger output console.

member.name: M:Sys.Debug.Fail(System.String)
member.summary: Displays a message in the debugger's output window and breaks into the debugger.
member.param: The message to display.

member.name: M:Sys.Debug.Trace(System.String)
member.summary: Appends a text line to the debugger console and to the TraceConsole<textarea> element, if available.
member.param: The text to display.

member.name: M:Sys.Debug.TraceDump(System.Object)
member.summary: Dumps an object to the debugger console and to the TraceConsole<textarea> element, if available.
member.param: The object to dump.

member.name: M:Sys.Debug.TraceDump(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Dumps an object to the debugger console and to the TraceConsole<textarea> element, if available.
member.param: The object to dump.
The name of the object.

member.name: T:Sys.Application
member.summary: Provides members that support client-component development.

member.name: M:Sys.Application.AddComponent(Sys.Component)
member.summary: Registers a component with the application and initializes it if the component is not already initialized.
member.param: An instance of a type derived from the class to register with the client application.

member.name: M:Sys.Application.FindComponent(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the specified object.
member.param: A string that contains the ID of the component to find.
member.returns: A Component object that contains the component requested by ID, if found; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Sys.Application.FindComponent(System.String,Sys.IContainer)
member.summary: Returns the specified object.
member.param: A string that contains the ID of the component to find.
The component or element that contains the component to find.
member.returns: A Component object that contains the component requested by ID, if found; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Sys.Application.GetComponents
member.summary: Returns an array of all components that have been registered with the application by using the method.
member.returns: An array of all components that have been registered with the application by using the AddComponent method.

member.name: M:Sys.Application.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the application and raises the event.

member.name: M:Sys.Application.NotifyScriptLoaded
member.summary: Called by a referenced script to indicate that it has been loaded.

member.name: M:Sys.Application.QueueScriptReference(System.String)
member.summary: Sequentially queues the scripts to be loaded in the queued order.
member.param: The URL for the referenced script.

member.name: M:Sys.Application.RegisterDisposableObject(Sys.IDisposable)
member.summary: Registers with the application an object that will require disposing.
member.param: The object to register.

member.name: M:Sys.Application.RemoveComponent(Sys.Component)
member.summary: Removes the object from the application and disposes the object if it is disposable.
member.param: The component to remove.

member.name: M:Sys.Application.UnregisterDisposableObject(Sys.IDisposable)
member.summary: Unregisters a disposable object from the application.
member.param: The object to unregister.

member.name: P:Sys.Application.IsCreatingComponents
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the application is in the process of creating components.

member.name: E:Sys.Application.Init
member.summary: Raised after all scripts have been loaded but before objects are created.

member.name: E:Sys.Application.Load
member.summary: Raised after all scripts have been loaded and the objects in the application have been created and initialized.

member.name: E:Sys.Application.Unload
member.summary: Raised before all objects in the client application are disposed, typically when the DOM window.unload event is raised.

member.name: T:Sys.Net.WebRequestManager
member.summary: Manages the flow of Web requests between the object and the executor instance that makes the network requests.

member.name: P:Sys.Net.WebRequestManager.DefaultExecutorType
member.summary: Gets or sets the default network executor type that is used to make network requests.

member.name: P:Sys.Net.WebRequestManager.DefaultTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time-out for the default network executor.
member.value: The time in milliseconds that the default executor should wait before timing out a Web request. This value must be 0 or a positive integer.

member.name: E:Sys.Net.WebRequestManager.InvokingRequest
member.summary: Occurs before the Web request has executed.

member.name: E:Sys.Net.WebRequestManager.CompletedRequest
member.summary: Occurs after a web request has executed.

member.name: T:Sys.Net.WebServiceSuccessCallback
member.summary: Delegate for handling the WebServiceProxy.Invoke success callback.
member.param: The result of the Web service call: either JSON, XML, or text.
Any user-specific information. userContext can be any JavaScript primitive type, array, or object.
The name of the Web service method that was invoked.
